DOC.TEXT: Stock prices declined broadly today, extending the decline that began late last week. The Dow Jones average of 30 industrials, down 14.08 on Friday, dropped another 24.96 to 2,714.59 by 2 p.m. today on Wall Street. Losers outnumbered gainers by more than 3 to 1 in nationwide trading of New York Stock Exchange-listed issues, with 359 up, 1,148 down and 436 unchanged. Brokers said traders remained uneasy about the outlook for real-estate finance and regional bank stocks after the Bank of New England on Friday announced projected increases in its loan-loss reserve and non-performing assets. In the past couple of weeks, Wall Street has been devoting increased concern to the soft real estate market in many parts of the country and the problems real-estate debt might pose should prices of properties lag for an extended period. Bank of New England shares led the active list, down 1[ at 7~ on the heels of a 3]-point drop Friday. Among other mortgage and regional banking issues, Citytrust Bancorp fell 1} to 15]; Federal National Mortgage 2{ to 31\, and Federal Home Loan Mortgage 4\ to 63{. Losers among the blue-chip industrials included International Business Machines, down 1] at 93|; American Express, down ~ at 32], and McDonald's, down \ at 34. Otherwise, analysts said hopes persisted that stocks could overcome their recent hesitancy and gain ground in the next few weeks, aided by the lifting of pressures from yearend tax selling. The NYSE's composite index of all its listed common stocks dropped 2.21 to 191.24. At the American Stock Exchange, the market value index was off 3.34 at 372.16. Volume on the Big Board came to 122.73 million shares with two hours to go.
